properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 8 at 2:16PM PST until February 11 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Strong northeast wind gusts of 50
mph or higher possible from the ridge tops to the coastal
mountain slopes. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including
during the morning and evening commutes on Monday. Tree branches
could fall as well. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches,
except 6 to 10 inches possible over eastern sections of the San
Bernardinos, including Big Bear Lake and along Highway 38 as
well as Highway 18 near and east of Big Bear.

* WHERE...Mountains of San Bernardino County above 4000 feet.
Light snow could impact the Cajon Pass near Cajon Summit
beginning Sunday night. Heavy snow could impact Highway 38 and
Highway 18.

* WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant reductions in visibility are
possible.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant
snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue
to monitor the latest forecasts.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET
